property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Some fight for honor and some for gold, but the militia fight for hearth and home.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Target opponent draws a card. You gain 7 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Bargaining with a goblin is like trading with a child; both believe they already own everything.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Let the unjust avert their faces and contemplate their peril.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Join the army, see foreign countries" they'd said.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Champion Lancer by creatures.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The flash of his lance projects the pure radiance of his honor.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: A true warrior's thoughts are of victory, not death.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The heart's courage is the soul's guardian.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Devout Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The enthusiasm of the young, sharpened by the discipline of a soldier.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Target player skips all combat phases of their next turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Mutual consent is not required for war.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Infantry deployment is the art of putting your troops in the wrong place at the right time.

property.name: Rules
property.value: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "You'll lose a duel if your enemy comes expecting a war."

property.name: Flavor
property.value: ". . . Before honor is humility." - The Bible, Proverbs 15:33

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Loyal Sentry blocks a creature, destroy that creature and Loyal Sentry.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "You could die famous or you could die old. I chose old." - Former soldier

property.name: Rules
property.value: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Bravery shines brightest in a pure soul.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Destroy all tapped creatures. You gain 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Hunter by instinct, weapon by training.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever Royal Trooper blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Fortune does not side with the faint-hearted." - Sophocles, Phaedra

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "For he on honey-dew hath fed, And drunk the milk of Paradise." - Samuel Taylor Coleridge, "Kubla Khan"

property.name: Rules
property.value: Creatures you control get +0/+3 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Brute force wins the battles. Conviction wins the wars.

property.value: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.

property.value: Age wears the flesh but galvanizes the soul.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Bitter as wormwood, sweet as mulled wine.

property.value: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Spirit is the sword and experience the sharpening stone. - Arabian proverb

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Two little goblins, out in the sun. Down came a griffin, and then there was one.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: As insubstantial, and as powerful, as the wind that carries it.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Some fishers like to eat eels, and some eels like to eat fishers.

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Denizen of the Deep enters the battlefield, return each other creature you control to its owner's hand.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during their next untap step.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card into their graveyard.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: At the sight of the thing the calamari vendor's eyes went wide, but from fear or avarice none could tell.

property.value: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Are merfolk humans with fins, or are humans merfolk with feet?

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The phantom warrior comes from nowhere and returns there just as quickly.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Until end of turn, you may tap lands you don't control for mana. Spend this mana only to cast spells.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The sea gives, and the sea takes. Some just help with the taking.

property.name: Rules
property.value: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. Put any number of them on the bottom of that library in any order and the rest on top of the library in any order.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The hardest lessons to grasp are the ones you've already learned.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: When your enemies are denied soldiers, they are denied victory.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Where air meets water, fish meets talon.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.

property.value: Storm crow descending, winter unending. Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

property.value: "Many wearing rapiers are afraid of goose-quills." - William Shakespeare, Hamlet

property.name: Rules
property.value: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

property.value: Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.

property.value: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.

property.value: "I don't want what I don't have. I want more of what I do have."

property.value: Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Its swamp cousin may be meaner, but the vizzerdrix is much bigger.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The water that a ship sails on is the same water that swallows it up. - Chinese proverb

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings."William Blake, The Marriage of Heaven and Hell

property.value: One or two target creatures gain flying until end of turn.

property.value: It pays to be at home both on the sea and in the sky.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: It moved through the troops leaving no footprints, save on their souls.

property.value: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: When nightstalkers sing, nothing in creation sleeps.

property.value: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.

property.value: "Human tenderness is simply weakness in a pretty package."

property.value: "Cursed be the sickly forms that err from honest Nature's rule" - Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "Locksley Hall"

property.value: The darkness of his shield reflects the inky blackness of his soul.

property.value: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The tiniest cough can be deadlier than the fiercest dragon.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: A scorpion this big you won't find curled up in your boot. Maybe around your boot, but not in it.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Dakmor Sorceress's power is equal to the number of Swamps you control.

property.value: Destroy target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.

property.value: He who goes unpunished never learns. - Greek proverb

property.value: The touch of death is never gentle.

property.value: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: I howl my soul to the moon, and the moon howls with me.

property.value: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

property.value: When the sky's rain has turned to fire, what will put it out?

property.value: There is much talk about the art of creation. What about the art of destruction?

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Its voice has the tremor of deafening thunder, its blow the force of an avalanche.

property.value: You are drawn to your death as a moth to the flame.

property.value: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

property.value: They get along so well with their goats because they're practically goats themselves.

property.value: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

property.value: They have to replace the wheels, they have to replace the boar, and sometimes they have to replace the goblin.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Lead, follow, or run around like crazy.

property.value: The goblins call the gliders "death from above." Everyone else calls them "clods in the clouds."

property.value: When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero - everyone else just has to step back.

property.value: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random.

property.value: "I done forgot more than you'll ever know, pipsqueak." "Yeah - that's your problem."

property.value: Goblin mountaineer, barely keeps his family fed.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Be it ever so crumbled, there's no place like home.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The bigger they are, the harder they avoid work.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Once they realized the ogre had more size than speed, the soldiers simply went around it.

property.value: Jagged Lightning deals 3 damage to each of two target creatures.

property.value: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.

property.value: Meant to cut through the body and burn straight to the soul.

property.value: Just because they have a club doesn't mean they're organized.

property.value: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

property.value: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

property.value: Lift your spear as you might lift your glass, and toast your enemy.

property.value: All orggs know how to kill; training teaches them what to kill.

property.value: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

property.value: Speed and fire are always a deadly combination.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.

property.value: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.

property.value: No earthly armor is protection against this sweetness.

property.value: In its lair lies a carpet of bones.

property.value: Stay alert: his lumbering may shake the ground itself, but in water, he glides.

property.value: They were formidable even before they learned the use of weapons.

property.value: Don't worry about provoking grizzly bears; they come that way.

property.value: Rarely seen, hardly heard, never caught.

property.value: The nightstalkers' little game of tease-the-squirrel suddenly took an unexpected turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I am that merry wanderer of the night." - William Shakespeare, A Midsummer Night's Dream

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The dying ask for water because they know it contains life.

property.value: Green creatures you control gain forestwalk until end of turn. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

property.value: Search your library for a Forest card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Every seed planted is another lesson the forest can teach us.

property.value: Death just encourages life the more.

property.value: His true majesty is not in his silver, but in his size.

property.value: Neither predator nor prey, the elephant chooses its place in the battle.

property.value: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.

property.value: "To-night the winds begin to rise . . . The rooks are blown about the skies . . . ." - Alfred, Lord Tennyson, In Memoriam

property.value: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.

property.value: It's hard to say for certain which end is more dangerous.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: It has the run of the swamps, and it knows it.

property.value: The forest lives in the elf as the elf lives in the forest.
